intro: Iphigenia ratnagirica, commonly known as the Ratnagiri iphigenia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, with a smooth texture, and it produces red or orange berries that are edible. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
